children.name: crash b2
children.definition: crash/kræʃ/  if a computer or a piece of software crashes, or if you crash it, it suddenly and unexpectedly stops working:
examples: sập nguồn
▪ my computer crashed, and we couldn’t get it working again.
crashverbfail ( bat tinh )
[ i ] if a computer or system crashes, it suddenly stops operating
_my laptop's crashed again.
crashnoun[ c ]failure
when a computer or system suddenly stops operating
_a computer crash

children.name: freeze/freeze up x
children.definition: freeze/freeze up/friːz, ˌfriːz ˈʌp/  if a computerscreenfreezes, the computer will not accept any instructions because of a fault and everything on the screen is fixed in position:
examples: đơ, treo
▪ the screen froze up, it crashed, and i lost all my work.

children.name: down c1
children.definition: down/daʊn/  if a computer system is down, it has stopped working because of a fault or a problem:
examples: sập nguồn
▪ our computers are down right now, could you call back in an hour?go down
▪ the whole network went down without any warning.

children.name: bug b2
children.definition: bug/bʌg/  a small fault in a computer program which prevents it from working properly:
examples: lỗi
▪ some bug in the program meant when i typed in a letter i got a number instead.
bugnouncomputer lỗi
[ c ]a mistake or problemin a computer program
_a bug caused the company's computer system to crash.

children.name: virus b1
children.definition: virus/ˈvaɪərəs/  a set of instructions that have been secretly put on a computer or a computer program, that can destroy or change information stored there. viruses spread easily from one computer or computer program to another:
examples: vi rút
▪ a warning has gone out about a new virus that could wipe everything off your hard disk.
▪ you cannot get a virus from an email message alone.
virusnoun[ c ]computer problem
a computer program or part of a computer program which can make copies of itself and is intended to prevent the computer from working normally

children.name: corrupt x
children.definition: corrupt/kəˈrʌpt/ also corrupted /kəˈrʌptɪd, kəˈrʌptəd/  information on a computer that is corrupt has been damaged and can no longer be read or used by the computer:
examples: sửa đổi sai lạc đi, lỗi
▪ a corrupted file
▪ some segments of your hard drive are corrupt.
corruptadjectivecomputer
when information on a computer becomescorrupt,it is spoilt and cannot be used because it has become changed in wrong ways
_corrupt data
_a corrupt file ( mot fire loi )
corruptionnouncomputer
[ u ] when the information on a computer is changed in wrong ways so that it cannot be used
_data corruption
corruptverb[ t ]computer
to changethe information on a computer in wrong ways so that it cannot be used
_most of the data on the hard drive was corrupted by the power cut.

children.name: menu a2
examples: a list of choicesthat can be made to appear on a computer screen
_select the 'edit' menu and then choose 'copy'.
menu barnoun[ c ]thanh menu
a long, narrow area usually at the top of a computer screen that contains lists of instructions to the computer. these lists are kept out of view until you choose to see them
_click 'file' in the menu bar, then click 'exit'.

children.name: icon b2
examples: a small picture or symbol on a computer screen that you point to andclickon (= press) with amouse(= small control device) to give the computer an instruction

children.name: command c1
examples: [ c] an instructionto a computer to perform a particular action

children.name: scan c1
examples: [ i or t ] to use a machine to put a picture of a document into a computer, or to takea picture of the inside of something
_i'll just scan the article into the computer.
_volunteers' brains were scanned while they looked at the pictures.
_all hand luggage has to be scanned.

children.name: simulation c1
children.definition: simulationnounsự bắt chước; sự mô phỏng
examples: a model of a set of problems or events that can be used to teach someone how to do something,or the process of making such a model
_the manager prepared a computer simulationoflikely sales performance for the rest of the year.

children.name: file extension x
examples: adotfollowed by three letters, such as .doc or .jpg, that forms the end of the name of a computer document
_be sure to type in the document name and file extension before you click 'save'.

children.name: address x
examples: the placewhere a piece of information is stored in a computer's memory

children.name: folder b1
examples: a placeon a computer wherefilesorprogramscan be stored

children.name: document b1
examples: a textthat is written and stored on a computer
_i'll send you the document by email.

children.name: file a2
children.definition: file/faɪl/  a collection of information on a computer that is stored under a particular name:
examples: tài liệu
▪ i seem to have lost the file with all my personal records on it.
▪ just click on the icon to open the file.
▪ it’s a good idea to save your files to a floppy disk as a backup.
filenouncomputer tập tin
[ c] informationstored on a computer as one unit with one name
_what's the file name?
_i'm going to copy/save this file.

children.name: database b2
children.definition: database/ˈdeɪtəˌbeɪs/  a very large collection of information kept on a computer:
examples: cơ sở dữ liệu
▪ we can check the database to see whether the book is in stock.
database of
cơ sở dữ liệu của
▪ the company has a database of over 23,000 hotels that allow pets.
databasenoun[ c ] cơ sở dữ liệu
a large amount of information stored in a computer system in such a way that it can be easily looked at or changed
_we're linked to the on-line database at our head office.

children.name: download b1
examples: a computer program or informationthat has been or can be downloaded

children.name: backup copy/backup b2
children.definition: backup copy/backup/ˈbækʌp ˌkɒpiǁ-ˌkɑːpi, ˈbækʌp/  a copy of computer information that you save on a separate disk, so that if something goes wrong with your computer, you will still have the information:
examples: bản dự phòng
▪ make sure to make backup copies of all your data.
▪ don’t store the backups near the computer, where someone could easily steal them both.
backup,alsoback-upnoun bản sao dự phòng; bản sao lưu
[ c ]a copy of informationthat is held on computer, which is storedseparately from the computer
_before we leave work each day, wemakea backupofall the records
_we have entered into the computer that day.
_the department's backupdisksare all stored in a different building.

children.name: archive x
examples: a computerfile used to store electronic information or documents that you no longer need to use regularly
archiveverb[ t ] nén
in computing,to store electronic informationthat you no longer need to use regularly
_this software helps firms archive and retrieve emails.

children.name: desktop b2
examples: [ c ]a view on a computer screenwhich is intended to represent the top of a desk and which containsicons(= small symbols or pictures) that represent files, programs and other features of the computer
_the menu bar with its windows is one of the features of the desktop.

children.name: window b1
examples: [ c ]a separate areaon a computer screen which shows information and which you can move around
_to minimize/maximize a window

children.name: interface x
examples: a connectionbetween two pieces of electronic equipment,or between a person and a computer
_my computer has a network interface, which allows me to get to other computers.
_the new version of the program comes with a much betteruserinterface (= way of showing information to a user) than the original.

children.name: wallpaper x
examples: [ u ]specializeda design or image that you choose to appear on thedesktop(= main) screen of your computer

children.name: slide show x
children.definition: slide shownounhiện hình trượt; chiếu slide
examples: when a computer shows several different photographs one after another on a screen

children.name: graphical user interface x
examples: (abbreviationgui) giao diện đồ hoạ
a way of arranging information on a computer screen that is easy to understand and use because it usesicons,menusand amouserather than only text

children.name: process x
examples: [ t ] if a computer processes information, it performs a particular series of operations on the information, such as a set of calculations.
processingnoun[ u ] xử lý
_data processing

children.name: multitasking x
examples: the ability of a computer to operate several programs at one time
_the machine allows multitasking without the need to buy extra hardware.

children.name: parallel processing x
examples: when a computer does two or more pieces of work at the same time

children.name: data processing x
children.definition: data processingnoun sự xử lý dữ liệu
examples: the use of a computer to perform calculations ondata
_a data-processing bureau

children.name: information technology x
children.definition: information technology (abbit) the science and activity of using computers and other electronic equipment to store and send information : công nghệ thông tin

children.name: computer science x
children.definition: computer sciencethe studyof computers and how they can be used khoa học vi tính

children.name: artificial intelligence c2
children.definition: artificial intelligence (abbai)the study of how to produce machinesthat have some of the qualities that the human mind has, such as the ability to understand language, recognize pictures, solve problems and learn : trí thông minh nhân tạo

children.name: virtual reality b2
children.definition: virtual reality set of images and sounds produced by a computer, which seem to represent a place or a situation that a person can take part in : thực tế ảo

children.name: technical support x
children.definition: technical supportnoun hỗ trợ kỹ thuật
examples: an advice service provided, usually over the telephone, to help people who have problems using a computer
_we had to make five calls to technical support to get the computer working.

children.name: configuration x
examples: [ c or u ]the wayin which all the equipment that makes up a computer system is set to operate,or whenyouadjust(= make small changes to) a computer system in a particular way

children.name: electronic b1
examples: relating to computers or something that is done by computers
_electronic communication/cash
_electronic publishing

children.name: virtual b2
examples: describes something that can be done orseen using a computer and therefore without going anywhere or talking to anyone
_virtual shopping

children.name: system b1
examples: [ c ] a set of computer equipment and programs used together for a particular purpose
_the system keeps crashing and no one is able to figure out why.
